reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stumbled upon Newton House on a dark autumn evening, and thank our luck for such a good, easy parking, find, after a long drive. Stella (former owner/present landlady in denise's temporary absence) welcomed us to the downstairs double, settled us in, and then suggested we visit Blind Jacks in the town centre. Great advice. We enjoyed geat beer and friendly company, and finished up with a special curry night at zolsha's in the main road. It's a lovely town, really worth a visit. Back at Newton House: the huge bed, beautiful throw, sparkly shower, tv, digital radio, hairdryer and soft towels were a real warm welcome. Breakfast was even better:: fruit, juices, cereals, hot plums, yoghurts, porridge with cream and whisky, smoked haddock, any sort of eggs, or full English. all with lashings of toast along with homemade marmalade and jam.. If there had been any stops, they'd been well pulled out for our visit! The hotel's recommended walks offered a chance to further enjoy the stuning scnery of yorkshire. A definite YES from us, and we're not even northern.......
reviews.title: everything you could want

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: A warm welcome was given to us by Denise and her staff when we had a family week-end at Newton House. Our rooms were excellent, clean and very comfortable and the food delicious. Denise very kindly catered for my gluten free diet, it was exceptional. I would strongly recommend you try it, but save me some plums.
reviews.title: The Little Gem Of North Yorkshire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Newton House has that rare ambience that makes you feel at home immediately. Denises welcome was friendly her and wealth of local knowledge pointed us to some very good local restaurants, and Knaresborough is a delightful town. The rooms were warm, clean, well appointed, and we had a four poster bed. The breakfasts are excellent and I can't recommend the poached plums with cinnamon enough, they are to die for! The staff are friendly and helpful. We will be back again soon, highly recommended
reviews.title: What a welcoming place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second stay at Newton House. Very pleased that Denise has continued the very high standards and added her own individual touches. Our room was warm and comfortable - housekeeping was excellent. Breakfast offered very good choice and staff were very pleasant and helpful. Good local knowledge of the staff was a bonus. A lovely three day break.
reviews.title: Really friendly and very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: This is the second time I have stayed at Newton House. The bed was lovely and comfy and the room was spacious, clean and beautifully furnished. Great location (easy to find and close to all main attractions in knaresborough). The breakfast was delicious (especially the baked plums)and everyone who worked there was polite and friendly. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Lovely rooms, friendly staff, great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We bookbutler minute, but Denise was welcoming and helpful. The B&B is warm and comfortable with beautifully decorated rooms. We were tucked up away on the top floor, and it was quiet and cost - just what we needed for a quiet weekend away! Denise shared some local knowledge with us, and made us feel like nothing was too big or too small. Breakfast was fab (I had the eggs benedict and the other half had a full English). Lots of lovely extras throughout the B&B help make it a very special place to stay. We'll be back!
reviews.title: Beautiful and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: stayed here 2 nights in a single room.the room was cosy and warm . very clean, plenty of towels, shower gels shampoos etc. had a problem saturday night with no hot water and couldnt contact denise until it was too late.the breakfast is excellant and the staff very good. i would stay her again and recommend it to others.
reviews.title: a lovely weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really enjoyed my stay here. Breakfast was fantastic. Not sure about free sweeties - think I ate too many eclairs :-) Staff where warm and friendly. Rooms where immaculate. Lovely comfy beds and stiff linen. Thank-you. Look forward to return.
reviews.title: Quaint & Quirky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I spent two days here with a small team and used it as a 'home from home'. Great hospitality, food all locally sourced, good to be able to walk to the pub and good restaurants. Worked well as a comfortable space to talk and focus on relationship within the team.
reviews.title: A unique team event

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended as a unique venue.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel We have Stayed at in England

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had to attend a wedding the weekend before Christmas, travelling from the South Coast and leaving at 4.30 a.m. to beat the pre-holiday traffic. I asked Denise if it would be possible to check in early, and my room was ready for me at 9.30. It made all the difference. A friendly welcome, a comfortable room and a lovely breakfast were all additional plusses. I would stay again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Comfortable room. Lovely breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Excellent clean, spacious hotel with amazing breakfasts and welcoming hosts. At £95 a night for a double en-suite with breakfast perhaps a little pricey (in keeping with the surrounding area however) but can't really fault the hotel in any other way. Located in the centre of town.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay in Knaresborough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was nice to meet Denise as we hadn't been since she took over. She has continued to provide the experience we always expected from Newton House. Top notch room & a lovely breakfast. We'll be back in the Spring/Summer, Scott & Nok.
reviews.title: Not been for a while, won't leave it as long next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic! I can't recommend this place enough. The staff were lovely, friendly and helpful. The breakfast was to die for (don't miss out on the homemade granola and aga-baked plums). The hotel was clean and extremely comfortable. Newton House is simply one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. My heavily pregnant wife and I had a most wonderful stay and will definitely be back in the future. Thanks Denise and co. We'll see you again soon!
reviews.title: Beautiful, comfortable and friendly place in Knaresborough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: I stayed with Denise and the team at the Newton House Hotel twice during a period of 3 weeks, whilst travelling with work and I was very impressed with the place. The hotel is a wonderful, charming period house with lots of character. Denise is very welcoming and couldn't do enough to help us out from the word go. Ans I was a fairly awkward customer. Arriving late and due to work commitments I had to get out by 0730. She rose early to make us breakfast and see us in our way. I stayed in many hotels during that 3 weeks in Harrogate and Knaresborough, as the Newton was sometimes booked, but whenever I came back to the NHH it felt like I was coming home. and the breakfasts... Homemade granola, stewed plums in cinnamon, and cooked treats such as eggs benedict, all cooked fresh... A real treat compared with the chain hotels that seem to serve en masse. And if you're worried that Knaresborough doesn't have much to offer, get down to the river and check out the beautiful viaduct/aquaduct (I never did find out)...and spend an afternoon otter spotting. And there's some great pubs. Favourites were Blind Jacks and the Mitre, but there's many to choose from. Knaresborough is charming. And the NHH is the best in town.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel has only 12 rooms and all are I think under £100. Ours was a very large double (superior) at £85 and was really good value.
reviews.title: Really excellent cosy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is a real gem and on a snowy freezing cold January day was a brilliantly cosy hotel to stay in.
reviews.title: Another enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated on a main street on the edge of the centre of town it has a small car park via an archway with space for 5-6 cars.
reviews.title: Sooooo dog friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bedroom was traditional, very large and spotlessly clean with a massive bed, lovely cotton bed linen. The attached bathroom is warm well facilitated with everything you would need.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast was exceptional - absolutely delicious, with large portions of locally sourced food and the bacon, sausage, eggs and mushrooms were special and the granola was homemade and went really well with the fresh rhubarb and banana compote. Jams and marmalade were homemade. The atmosphere throughout is very friendly and breakfast was very sociable. There is really comfortable lounge with honesty bar. A nice touch are the free sweeties downstairs and in the bedrooms.
reviews.title: Better than big-name hotels
